ygData.subject: Re: Non-twinked Druids
ygData.msgSnippet: Yes, Cojim, ports are a great way to make money. I lately spent most of mine working on my trade skills and finally buying a wisdom deity. I know I can make it
ygData.messageBody:
Yes, Cojim, ports are a great way to make money.
I lately spent most of mine working on my trade
skills and finally buying a wisdom deity. I know I can
make it back quickly . . . on a good day, I can make
close to 100pp in less than an hour, especially if you
port people from Kunark.<br>My rant (ah, there's
always a catch!) is that lots of people decide they
don't need to pay me. I can't tell you how many people
I've gone out of my way to port lately who have not
given me a single cp for my trouble. Where have
everyone's manners gone? For all you people out there who do
pay, I'm sorry you have to listen, but everyone else,
show some respect! Druids and wizards who port you are
under no obligation to do so! It's a favor they are
doing for you--*especially* if they have to come to
you. I really hate to do it, but it's gotten so bad
lately that I write down names of people who are rude or
won't pay, and refuse to port them. I also have decided
to ask for money before we leave, since my modem is
also slow, and people zone much faster than I do; they
can be on their way and not wait for me. As one of my
guildies wisely put is, "You don't buy your plane tickets
after your flight."<br>I'm done being irate now. I
apologize.<br><br>Kanissa Noryk of Norraths Keepers<br>Serving Tunare for
34 seasons!<br>Rodcet Nife
